module.name: independent_property_definition
module.keywords: module, physical quantity, property, characteristic, value

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies a physical quantity value which is the magnitude of an aspect of a physical object that can be determined by observation or measurement.
purpose.example: A temperature of 400 degrees Celsius is a physical quantity value.

example.p: A force of 10000 N is a physical quantity value.

This force may be the shear force at a point in the beam. The fact that the force is a shear force, rather than an axial force, is indicated by the type of the relationship between the physical quantity value and the beam.
A pressure of 15 Bar is a physical quantity value.

This pressure may be the maximum operating pressure of a vessel. The fact that the pressure is the maximum operating pressure, for the vessel rather than the hydrostatic test pressure for the vessel, is indicated by the type of relationship between physical quantity value and the vessel.

li.p: the magnitude of an observable or measurable quantity;
li.note: This concept is called a 'physical quantity value'.
li.example: The temperature of 400 degrees Celsius is a physical quantity value.
li.note: A physical quantity value is a class that has members. The members of 400 degrees Celsius are all objects that have this temperature.

li.p: the physical quantity space that contains a physical quantity value;
li.note: A physical quantity space contains different physical quantity values for the same physical phenomenon.
li.example: Temperature is a physical quantity space. The physical quantity value that is the temperature of 400 degrees Celsius is a member of this space.

li.p: the symmetry of a physical quantity value;
li.example: Isotropic is a symmetry of a physical quantity value. The physical quantity value that is the elasticity with Young's modulus of 210000 MNm-2 and Poisson's ratio of 0.3 has isotropic symmetry.

li.p: a property distribution over a set of parts or features within a product, or a set of states within an activity;
a relationship between an physical quantity value and an individual product or activity, or a class of product or activity;
li.note: These relationships are within the scope of the Possession_of_property and Property_condition application modules.

li.p: a numerical description of physical quantity value with respect to a scale.
li.note: The description of the physical quantity value 400 degrees Celsius by the number 400 with respect to the Celsius scale, is within the scope of the Property_identification application module.

def.p: magnitude of an aspect of a physical thing that can be observed or measured, or deduced from observations or measurements
def.note: A physical quantity value is a class that a physical thing is can be a member of. Whether or not a physical thing is a member of the class is determined by the observation or measurement.

description.p: The Physical_quantity_value UoF records a physical quantity value, and specifies the physical quantity space of which it is a member.
The Physical_quantity_value UoF also specifies any tensor symmetry for a physical quantity value.
